algorithm_technique: Topological sort for row and column ordering
problem_summary_simple: Build a kxk matrix satisfying row and column ordering conditions for numbers 1 to k.
problem_summary_technical: Performs topological sort on row and column conditions to determine valid orderings, then constructs the matrix based on these orders.
time_complexity: O(k^2 + R + C) where R and C are the number of row/column conditions
key_insights: The problem can be modeled as finding valid topological sorts for two directed acyclic graphs (DAGs).
If a cycle is detected in either graph (topological sort fails), no valid matrix exists.
The positions of numbers in the matrix are determined by their order in the topological sorts.
